apis.description: Returns the paginated list of discussion topics for this course or group.

operations.notes: Returns the paginated list of discussion topics for this course or group.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Determines the order of the discussion topic list. Defaults to "position".

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Only return discussion topics in the given state(s). Defaults to including all topics. Filtering is done after pagination, so pages may be smaller than requested if topics are filtered. Can pass multiple states as comma separated string.

parameters.name: only_announcements
parameters.description: Return announcements instead of discussion topics. Defaults to false

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial title of the discussion topics to match and return.

apis.description: Returns the paginated list of discussion topics for this course or group.

operations.notes: Returns the paginated list of discussion topics for this course or group.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Determines the order of the discussion topic list. Defaults to "position".

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Only return discussion topics in the given state(s). Defaults to including all topics. Filtering is done after pagination, so pages may be smaller than requested if topics are filtered. Can pass multiple states as comma separated string.

parameters.name: only_announcements
parameters.description: Return announcements instead of discussion topics. Defaults to false

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The partial title of the discussion topics to match and return.

apis.description: Create an new discussion topic for the course or group.

operations.notes: Create an new discussion topic for the course or group.

parameters.name: discussion_type
parameters.description: The type of discussion. Defaults to side_comment if not value is given. Accepted values are 'side_comment', for discussions that only allow one level of nested comments, and 'threaded' for fully threaded discussions.

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Whether this topic is published (true) or draft state (false). Only teachers and TAs have the ability to create draft state topics.

parameters.name: delayed_post_at
parameters.description: If a timestamp is given, the topic will not be published until that time.

parameters.name: lock_at
parameters.description: If a timestamp is given, the topic will be scheduled to lock at the provided timestamp. If the timestamp is in the past, the topic will be locked.

parameters.name: podcast_enabled
parameters.description: If true, the topic will have an associated podcast feed.

parameters.name: podcast_has_student_posts
parameters.description: If true, the podcast will include posts from students as well. Implies podcast_enabled.

parameters.name: require_initial_post
parameters.description: If true then a user may not respond to other replies until that user has made an initial reply. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: assignment
parameters.description: To create an assignment discussion, pass the assignment parameters as a sub-object. See the {api:AssignmentsApiController#create Create an Assignment API} for the available parameters. The name parameter will be ignored, as it's taken from the discussion title. If you want to make a discussion that was an assignment NOT an assignment, pass set_assignment = false as part of the assignment object

parameters.name: is_announcement
parameters.description: If true, this topic is an announcement. It will appear in the announcement's section rather than the discussions section. This requires announcment-posting permissions.

parameters.name: position_after
parameters.description: By default, discussions are sorted chronologically by creation date, you can pass the id of another topic to have this one show up after the other when they are listed.

parameters.name: group_category_id
parameters.description: If present, the topic will become a group discussion assigned to the group.

apis.description:
Update an existing discussion entry.

The entry must have been created by the current user, or the current user
must have admin rights to the discussion. If the edit is not allowed, a 401 will be returned.

operations.notes:
Update an existing discussion entry.

The entry must have been created by the current user, or the current user
must have admin rights to the discussion. If the edit is not allowed, a 401 will be returned.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The updated body of the entry.

apis.description:
Delete a discussion entry.

The entry must have been created by the current user, or the current user
must have admin rights to the discussion. If the delete is not allowed, a 401 will be returned.

The discussion will be marked deleted, and the user_id and message will be cleared out.

operations.notes:

The discussion will be marked deleted, and the user_id and message will be cleared out.

apis.description:
Return a cached structure of the discussion topic, containing all entries,
their authors, and their message bodies.

May require (depending on the topic) that the user has posted in the topic.
If it is required, and the user has not posted, will respond with a 403
Forbidden status and the body 'require_initial_post'.

In some rare situations, this cached structure may not be available yet. In
that case, the server will respond with a 503 error, and the caller should
try again soon.

The response is an object containing the following keys:
* "participants": A list of summary information on users who have posted to
  the discussion. Each value is an object containing their id, display_name,
  and avatar_url.
* "unread_entries": A list of entry ids that are unread by the current
  user. this implies that any entry not in this list is read.
* "forced_entries": A list of entry ids that have forced_read_state set to
  true. This flag is meant to indicate the entry's read_state has been 
  manually set to 'unread' by the user, so the entry should not be
  automatically marked as read.
* "view": A threaded view of all the entries in the discussion, containing
  the id, user_id, and message.
* "new_entries": Because this view is eventually consistent, it's possible
  that newly created or updated entries won't yet be reflected in the view.
  If the application wants to also get a flat list of all entries not yet
  reflected in the view, pass include_new_entries=1 to the request and this
  array of entries will be returned. These entries are returned in a flat
  array, in ascending created_at order.

  array, in ascending created_at order.

apis.description:
Create a new entry in a discussion topic. Returns a json representation of
the created entry (see documentation for 'entries' method) on success.

operations.notes:
Create a new entry in a discussion topic. Returns a json representation of
the created entry (see documentation for 'entries' method) on success.

parameters.name: attachment
parameters.description: a multipart/form-data form-field-style attachment. Attachments larger than 1 kilobyte are subject to quota restrictions.

apis.description:
Retrieve the (paginated) top-level entries in a discussion topic.

May require (depending on the topic) that the user has posted in the topic.
If it is required, and the user has not posted, will respond with a 403
Forbidden status and the body 'require_initial_post'.

Will include the 10 most recent replies, if any, for each entry returned.

If the topic is a root topic with children corresponding to groups of a
group assignment, entries from those subtopics for which the user belongs
to the corresponding group will be returned.

Ordering of returned entries is newest-first by posting timestamp (reply
activity is ignored).

operations.notes:

Ordering of returned entries is newest-first by posting timestamp (reply
activity is ignored).

apis.description:

May require (depending on the topic) that the user has posted in the topic.
If it is required, and the user has not posted, will respond with a 403
Forbidden status and the body 'require_initial_post'.

operations.notes:

Forbidden status and the body 'require_initial_post'.

apis.description:
Mark the discussion topic and all its entries as unread.

No request fields are necessary.

On success, the response will be 204 No Content with an empty body.

operations.notes:
Mark the discussion topic and all its entries as unread.

No request fields are necessary.

On success, the response will be 204 No Content with an empty body.

parameters.name: forced_read_state
parameters.description: A boolean value to set all of the entries' forced_read_state. No change is made if this argument is not specified.

apis.description:
Mark a discussion entry as read.

No request fields are necessary.

On success, the response will be 204 No Content with an empty body.

operations.notes:
Mark a discussion entry as read.

No request fields are necessary.

On success, the response will be 204 No Content with an empty body.

parameters.name: forced_read_state
parameters.description: A boolean value to set the entry's forced_read_state. No change is made if this argument is not specified.

apis.description:
Unsubscribe from a topic to stop receiving notifications about new entries

On success, the response will be 204 No Content with an empty body

operations.notes:
Unsubscribe from a topic to stop receiving notifications about new entries

On success, the response will be 204 No Content with an empty body

message.description: The HTML content of the message body.

html_url.description: The URL to the discussion topic in canvas.

posted_at.description: The datetime the topic was posted. If it is null it hasn't been posted yet. (see delayed_post_at)

last_reply_at.description: The datetime for when the last reply was in the topic.

require_initial_post.description: If true then a user may not respond to other replies until that user has made an initial reply. Defaults to false.

user_can_see_posts.description: Whether or not posts in this topic are visible to the user.

discussion_subentry_count.description: The count of entries in the topic.

read_state.description: The read_state of the topic for the current user, 'read' or 'unread'.

unread_count.description: The count of unread entries of this topic for the current user.

subscribed.description: Whether or not the current user is subscribed to this topic.

subscription_hold.description: (Optional) Why the user cannot subscribe to this topic. Only one reason will be returned even if multiple apply. Can be one of: 'initial_post_required': The user must post a reply first 'not_in_group_set': The user is not in the group set for this graded group discussion 'not_in_group': The user is not in this topic's group 'topic_is_announcement': This topic is an announcement

assignment_id.description: The unique identifier of the assignment if the topic is for grading, otherwise null.

delayed_post_at.description: The datetime to publish the topic (if not right away).

published.description: Whether this discussion topic is published (true) or draft state (false)

lock_at.description: The datetime to lock the topic (if ever).

locked.description: Whether or not the discussion is 'closed for comments'.

pinned.description: Whether or not the discussion has been 'pinned' by an instructor

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This discussion is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

user_name.description: The username of the topic creator.

topic_children.description: An array of topic_ids for the group discussions the user is a part of.

root_topic_id.description: If the topic is for grading and a group assignment this will point to the original topic in the course.

podcast_url.description: If the topic is a podcast topic this is the feed url for the current user.

discussion_type.description: The type of discussion. Values are 'side_comment', for discussions that only allow one level of nested comments, and 'threaded' for fully threaded discussions.

group_category_id.description: The unique identifier of the group category if the topic is a group discussion, otherwise null.

permissions.description: The current user's permissions on this topic.
